description: From Late Latin discontinuitās, from discontinuus.

entries.meaning: A lack of continuity, regularity or sequence; a break or gap. [from 16th c.]
examples: Shock waves are sudden discontinuities propagated in compressible media – usually air.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) A point in the range of a function at which it is undefined or discontinuous. [from 19th c.]
(geology) a subterranean interface at which seismic velocities change
